BiblioData.Title: METHOD FOR FORMING INTERPENETRATING NETWORKS OF DISTINCT MATERIALS AND DEVICES THEREFROM

Applicant.Name: UNIV FLORIDA [US]
UNIVERSITY OF FLORIDA RESEARCH FOUNDATION, INC

BiblioData.Abstract: An electrical or electro-optical device (100) includes a first layer (110) having a first composition. The first composition includes a plurality of electrically connected particles. A second layer (130) has a second composition, the second composition including a plurality of electrically connected particles. A composite layer (120) is disposed between the first and second layer. The composite layer is an interpenetrated network of a third and a fourth composition, wherein the third composition is different from the fourth composition. A first electrically interconnected network extends from the first composition in the first layer (110) to the third composition throughout a thickness of the composite layer (120), and a second electrically interconnected network extends from the second composition in the second layer (130) to the fourth composition throughout the thickness of the composite layer.

Claims.P: CLAIMS

1. An electrical or electro-optical device, comprising: a first layer comprising a first composition, said first composition comprising a plurality of electrically connected particles; a second layer comprising a second composition, said second composition comprising a plurality of electrically connected particles; a composite layer disposed between said first and said second layer, said composite layer comprising an interpenetrated network of a third and a fourth composition, said third composition being different from said fourth composition, wherein a first electrically interconnected network extends from said first composition in said first layer to said third composition throughout a thickness of said composite layer, and a second electrically interconnected network extends from said second composition in said second layer to said fourth composition throughout said thickness of said composite layer.
2. The device of claim 1, wherein at least one of said compositions comprises nanotubes, nanowires, or nanoparticles.

3. The device of claim 2, wherein said first layer, said second layer, and said composite layer comprise said nanowires, wherein said nanowires are preferentially oriented to generally lie along a plane.
4. The device of claim 1, wherein at least one of said first, said second, and said composite layers are porous layers.
5. The device of claim 4, further comprising a polymeric continuous phase infiltrating said porous layer.
6. The device of claim 1, wherein a concentration of said third and said fourth composition in said composite layer is stepwise graded.
7. The device of claim 1, wherein said second composition is different from said first composition.
8. The device of claim 1, wherein said first composition and said third composition are the same and said second and said fourth composition are the same.
9. The device of claim 1, wherein one of said third and fourth composition comprises a p-type semiconductor and the other of said third and fourth composition comprises an n-type semiconductor.
10. The device of claim 1, wherein said device comprises a solar cell.
11. The device of claim 1, wherein said device comprises a light emitting diode (LED).

12. The device of claim 1, wherein said device comprises a multi-component heterojunction structure, wherein said first layer, said second layer, and said composite layer comprise different compositions.
13. The device of claim 12, wherein said composite layer either develops a built- in potential for charge separation for photovoltaic applications or comprises a light emitting device.
14. A method of forming a layer stack for an electronic or an electro-optical device, comprising the steps of:
(a) providing a porous membrane;
(b) dispersing a plurality of nanotubes, nanowires or nanoparticles of a first composition in a solution;
(c) applying said solution to said membrane, and

(d) removing said solution, wherein said nanotubes, nanowires or nanoparticles are forced onto a surface of said porous membrane to form a first composition comprising layer disposed on said membrane; repeating steps (b)-(d) using a plurality of nanotubes, nanowires or nanoparticles of a second and third composition, wherein composite layer comprising an interpenetrated network of said second and said third composition is formed on said first composition comprising layer, and repeating steps (b)-(d) using a plurality of nanotubes, nanowires or nanoparticles of a fourth composition to form a fourth composition comprising film layer formed on said composite layer.
15. The method of claim 14, wherein one of said second and third composition comprises ap-type semiconductor and the other of said second and third composition comprises an n-type semiconductor.
16. The method of claim 14, wherein said device includes a substrate, further comprising the steps of placing said layer stack on said substrate, and selectively removing said membrane.
17. The method of claim 14, wherein said first, second and said composite layers are all porous layers.
18. The method of claim 17, further comprising the step of infiltrating at least one of said porous layers with a polymeric material.
